snippet: New York’s financial services superintendent said the state had tried to balance its interest in making insurance affordable and not putting too much stress on insurance companies.
abstract: Benjamin M Lawsky, New York State financial services superintendent, says that health insurance companies in the state will receive average rate increases of 5.7 percent in 2015, less than half requested for individual and family plans.
lead_paragraph: New York’s financial services superintendent said the state had tried to balance its interest in making insurance affordable and not putting too much stress on insurance companies.

headline.main: New York State Gives Health Insurers Average Rate Rise of 5.7%
headline.print_headline: New York State Gives Health Insurers Average Rate Rise of 5.7%

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
